title: Turning a Pull Chain Light Fixture into a Switch

steps.title: Generally, wall switches are on the right-hand side, a few feet/metres past the door opening.
steps.content: Generally, wall switches are on the right-hand side, a few feet/metres past the door opening. Go around your house and measure the height of other switches. 60" or 1.5m from the floor is common.

steps.title: If there are other people in the home, always tell them that you have turned off the power, or leave a note on the breaker/fuse box so someone doesn't accidentally turn it.
steps.content: If there are other people in the home, always tell them that you have turned off the power, or leave a note on the breaker/fuse box so someone doesn't accidentally turn it. [1] X Research source [2] X Expert Source Daniel Stoescu Master Electrician Expert Interview. 16 August 2021.

steps.title: Always add an extra 12" or 30 centimeter (11.8 in) to your measurement - it's always better to have too much electrical wire than not enough.
steps.content: Always add an extra 12" or 30 centimeter (11.8 in) to your measurement - it's always better to have too much electrical wire than not enough.

steps.title: Make sure there's no power coming from the light fixture.
steps.content: Make sure there's no power coming from the light fixture. Remove the black (or "hot") wire only. Leave the white (or "neutral") and any ground (green or bare) wires on the fixture. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Strip 2"/5 centimeter (2.0 in) of the plastic sheathing from the end of the black and white wires.
steps.content: Strip 2"/5 centimeter (2.0 in) of the plastic sheathing from the end of the black and white wires.

steps.title: Connect the black wire from the electrical cable with the black wire you just removed from your fixture.
steps.content: Connect the black wire from the electrical cable with the black wire you just removed from your fixture. Always use screw-on wire connectors..never use electrical tape. Ensure that the connection is tight. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Using a black marker, "re-code" the white wire from your electrical cable to black.
steps.content: Using a black marker, "re-code" the white wire from your electrical cable to black. Mark on the plastic sheathing with a permanent marker so that anyone will know this is now a "hot" wire. [5] X Research source

steps.title: You should now have a white and re-coded black wire on your fixture.
steps.content: You should now have a white and re-coded black wire on your fixture.

steps.title: Strip black and white wires as in step 5.
steps.content: Strip black and white wires as in step 5. Connect the ground wire to the electrical box itself (there should be a screw at the back or side of the box).

steps.title: You will need to re-code the white wire as a "hot" wire with a marker, as in step 7.
steps.content: You will need to re-code the white wire as a "hot" wire with a marker, as in step 7. [6] X Research source

steps.title: This will be the top of your switch.
steps.content: This will be the top of your switch.

steps.title: Ensure that both screws are secure and screw the switch into the electrical box.
steps.content: Ensure that both screws are secure and screw the switch into the electrical box. Do not attach the cover until you check that everything functions correctly

steps.title: Flick the switch to the "off" position, then turn on power to the fixture.
steps.content: Flick the switch to the "off" position, then turn on power to the fixture.

steps.title: If it does not, double check that you have not turned off the fixture from the chain/cord.
steps.content: If it does not, double check that you have not turned off the fixture from the chain/cord.

steps.title: You should always leave the light"on" at the chain/cord in order to have full control from the wall switch.
steps.content: You should always leave the light"on" at the chain/cord in order to have full control from the wall switch. You can still use the chain, however this defeats the purpose of having a wall switch.

steps.title: Provided everything works, you can close up your light fixture and attach a switch plate cover.
steps.content: Provided everything works, you can close up your light fixture and attach a switch plate cover.
